remarks: A proposition is testable iff its negative or double-negative is true. See Chapter 2 [Moschovakis] p. 2. Our notation for testability is ` DECID -. ` before the formula in question.  For example, ` DECID -. x = y ` corresponds to "x = y is testable".  (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 13-Aug-2018.)
